text: the puck drops Wednesday as the New York
Rangers in the Los Angeles Kings face
off in the Stanley Cup Finals three
storylines to watch on the New York
Times minute while New York and Los
Angeles have met in other sports finals
this is the first time ever for hockey
in baseball the Yankees played that
Dodgers four times and in basketball the
Knicks face the Lakers three times but
all this was more than 30 years ago so
this Cup final might get more than the
usual hockey fans intrigued two players
to watch one is Marian Gaborik Gaborik
forward for the Kings was a top scorer
for the Rangers just a year and a half
ago he's now up against his former
teammates who are all too well aware
that his speed could help make him a top
scorer in the series but he'll be facing
off against rangers goalie Henrik lunk
this who is possibly the best in the
world at that position what to expect
the Kings won the cup two years ago and
her considered favorites but they may be
drained after a hard one Western
Conference Finals against the Chicago
Blackhawks the Rangers meanwhile have
had extra rest so may be favored in Game
one still expect a long intense finals
